newsitem.title: INDIA: India RBI pays $231 mln in bond redemption.
newsitem.headline: India RBI pays $231 mln in bond redemption.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said it paid $231 million towards redemption of India Development Bonds on Wednesday.
The foreign exchange reserve level after the redemption is at $19.54 billion, it said.

"Out of the India Development Bonds (I Series) of $418 million due for redemption on January 15, 1997, the RBI has paid foreign currency amount of $231 million towards redemption of the bonds held by non-residents," an RBI statement said.
"The rest of the amount accounted for by transfer of the bonds to residents is redeemed in rupees," it said.
"The foreign exchange reserve level after the above redemption is at $19.54 billion," it added.
